He's called a lion because a lion is a brave person.

Posted By: Vorthosian (7/12/2009 6:07:16 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @LordFinbar. I don't know about a lot of downsides, but it's safe to say that probably over 90% of your rare creatures are shroudless and therefore suffer creature removal, so if that's the biggest peeve, well, he is white and white has plenty of instant and or enchantments for color protection. I found the easiest way to cancel out the Spellshaper Legends from the Prophecy series was to just run Squee Goblins for negating the discard effect. Anyway, Madness comes into play not too much further down the road, and a creature that can wrath/trigger 2 choice discards works fine for madness, threshold, lhurgoyf's, Judgement's Incarnations.... Anyway with that kind of versatility I can't help but favor it over the new Mythic Novablast Wurm. Not to mention the fact that Mageta includes a "cannot be regenerated" with its destroy ability.
posts.html:
@LordFinbar. I found the easiest way to cancel out the Spellshaper Legends from the Prophecy series was to just run Squee Goblins for negating the discard effect. Anyway, Madness comes into play not too much further down the road, and a creature that can wrath/trigger 2 choice discards works fine for madness, threshold, lhurgoyf's, Judgement's Incarnations.... Anyway with that kind of versatility I can't help but favor it over the new Mythic Novablast Wurm. Not to mention the fact that Mageta includes a "cannot be regenerated" with its destroy ability.

posts.post_content: I like the instant speed activation of a wrath effect. I also think that madness would be very fun with him (there are white madness cards, y'know). But this card is strictly casual. It can be killed before it does anything, it takes two turns to activate, and you lose two other cards. Ummm.... maybe if I can't find a Wrath or a Day of Judgment I'd run it.....nahhh....
